channel.title: Tcpdump on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Tcpdump on TLDRBins

item.title: Network Discovery
item.description: Test connectivity Linux Windows # Default infinite pings ping -c3 <TARGET> # Default 5 pings ping <TARGET> # Check specific port Test-NetConnection <TARGET> -Port <TARGET_PORT> Test reverse connectivity Linux sudo tcpdump -ni tun0 icmp Sniff network traffic Linux # For example: on port 389 sudo tcpdump -i lo -nnXs 0 'port <TARGET_PORT>' # Sniff HTTPS traffic sudo ./mitmdump -p 443 --mode reverse:https://<DOMAIN> --ssl-insecure --set flow_detail=3 Ref: mitmproxy Use ping to scan subnet Linux for i in $(seq 1 254); do (ping -c 1 10.
